intro: Cookia cyanocarpa, commonly known as the blue-fruited cookia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that turns blue when mature, giving the plant its common name. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
